snippet: The employees were said to be falsifying logbooks intended to keep track of residents.
abstract: Two workers at Boys Town home in Brooklyn are fired after investigation shows they falsified logbooks meant to keep track of residents; forging could have compromised security night that teenagers Sanaat Asliev, Emanuel Burrowes and Eric Pek are alleged to have left home and raped and robbed woman in Manhattan's Chinatown neighborhood.

byline.original: By AL BAKER and BENJAMIN MUELLER
byline.contributor: James C. McKinley Jr. contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The employees were said to be falsifying logbooks intended to keep track of residents.

headline.main: Two Lose Jobs at Brooklyn Group Home Where Rape Suspects Lived
headline.print_headline: Two Lose Jobs at Group Home Where Rape Suspects Lived
